summary.en: â€œIK/ikâ€ most commonly means â€œI knowâ€ in casual texting; it can also mean â€œinverse kinematicsâ€ in technical contexts.

definition.en: an informal text-message abbreviation for â€œI know.â€

examples.en: A: The test is tomorrow. B: Ik, Iâ€™m studying now.
Ik what you mean.

definition.en: abbreviation for â€œinverse kinematics,â€ used in robotics/animation.

examples.en: Turn on IK so the characterâ€™s feet stay on the ground.

summary.en: â€œikâ€ is a casual abbreviation meaning â€œI know,â€ mainly used in texting and online chat.

definition.en: Text-message abbreviation for â€œI know.â€

examples.en: ik, I saw the update already.
â€”This test is hard. â€”ik ğŸ˜­
ik what you mean.

definition.en: (Less common) An abbreviation for â€œinternet killed,â€ used online to say the internet suddenly stopped working or ended a stream/chat.

examples.en: Sorry, ikâ€”my Wiâ€‘Fi dropped.

summary.en: â€œikanâ€ is an Indonesian/Malay noun meaning â€œfish.â€

definition.en: (Indonesian/Malay) fish; a general word for fish (the animal) or fish as food, depending on context.

examples.en: In Indonesian, â€œikanâ€ means â€œfish.â€
Saya makan ikan. (I eat fish.)
Ikan ini segar. (This fish is fresh.)

summary.en: â€œIkaryâ€ isnâ€™t a standard English word; itâ€™s probably a misspelling or a proper name (e.g., Icarian/Ikaria/Ikari).

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It is likely a misspelling or a name (proper noun). Common possibilities: â€œIcarus/Icarianâ€ (from Greek myth), â€œIkariaâ€ (a Greek island), or â€œIkariâ€ (a surname/place name).

examples.en: I couldnâ€™t find â€œikaryâ€ in the dictionaryâ€”did you mean â€œIcarianâ€ or â€œIkariaâ€?
If you share the sentence, I can help identify what â€œikaryâ€ is supposed to be.

summary.en: Ikat is a tie-dye weaving technique (and the patterned fabric) where threads are dyed before weaving, creating distinctive designs.

definition.en: A traditional textile-making technique in which yarn is tie-dyed before weaving, creating patterned fabric (common in Indonesia and other parts of Southeast and Central Asia).

examples.en: She bought an ikat scarf while traveling in Indonesia.
Ikat patterns often look slightly blurred because the threads are dyed before weaving.

definition.en: Made in the ikat style; having an ikat pattern.

examples.en: He wore an ikat shirt to the cultural festival.
The living room has ikat cushions in blue and white.

summary.en: â€œIkeâ€ is most commonly Eisenhowerâ€™s nickname; it can also be a (rare) male name or a nickname for Isaac.

definition.en: A nickname for Dwight D. Eisenhower, the 34th President of the United States (and a WWII Supreme Allied Commander).

examples.en: Many Americans remember Ike as a leader during the early Cold War.
In history class, we learned that Ike was a famous WWII commander before becoming president.

definition.en: A male given name (less common) or a casual nickname for someone named Isaac.

examples.en: Ike is short for Isaac in some families.
Ike said heâ€™d be a little late to the meeting.

summary.en: IKEA is a well-known Swedish company selling affordable, modern, ready-to-assemble furniture and home goods; informally, it can also describe that simple â€œIKEA-styleâ€ look.

definition.en: a Swedish multinational company famous for affordable, modern-style furniture, home goods, and ready-to-assemble (flat-pack) products sold in large warehouse-like stores.

examples.en: We bought a bookshelf from IKEA and assembled it at home.
IKEA is known for simple design and affordable prices.
Letâ€™s meet at the IKEA cafeteria for lunch.

definition.en: (informal) a style associated with IKEA: simple, modern, and budget-friendly home design.

examples.en: She decorated her apartment in a very IKEA style.
The room looks IKEAâ€”clean lines and light colors.

summary.en: Ikebana is the Japanese art of flower arrangement, emphasizing balance, line, and negative space.

definition.en: The Japanese art of arranging flowers in a carefully balanced, artistic way, focusing on line, space, and harmony (not just making a bouquet look full).

examples.en: She took an ikebana class to learn Japanese flower arrangement.
In ikebana, empty space is part of the design.
The museum displayed ikebana alongside traditional Japanese ceramics.

summary.en: Ikebanas are Japanese-style flower arrangements; ikebana is the art of arranging flowers with balance and harmony.

definition.en: the Japanese art of arranging flowers in a simple, balanced way, focusing on line, space, and harmony (plural: ikebanas)

examples.en: She studies ikebana every Saturday at a local cultural center.
The hotel lobby displayed ikebanas that matched the season.

summary.en: Ikey is usually a personal name or nickname (often from Isaac), and it can also refer to the iKey brand of rugged keyboards.

definition.en: a male given name or nickname (often a short form of Isaac).

examples.en: Ikey was my great-grandfatherâ€™s nickname in our family.
I met a man named Ikey at the community center.

definition.en: a brand name used for rugged or industrial computer keyboards and input devices.

examples.en: The factory uses iKey keyboards because they are easy to clean.
We ordered an iKey unit for the control room computer.

summary.en: â€œIkeynessâ€ is a very rare, nonstandard noun meaning â€œthe quality of being ikey,â€ often a playful made-up word; in some older contexts it may connect to offensive usage, so use with care.

definition.en: (Very rare, nonstandard) The quality or state of being â€œikey.â€ Often used as a playful, made-up word meaning â€œhaving Ikey-like traits.â€

examples.en: In his journal he joked about his â€œikeyness,â€ meaning his habit of telling the same stories.
The word â€œikeynessâ€ here is informal and personal, not standard English.

summary.en: Ikhwan means â€œbrothers/brethrenâ€ in Arabic-derived usage, and it can also refer to specific historical or political groups (especially the Muslim Brotherhood).

definition.en: (from Arabic) â€œbrothersâ€ or â€œbrethren,â€ often used to refer to a group of male members, classmates, or fellow believers (common in Malay/Indonesian and in Islamic contexts).

examples.en: The invitation welcomed the ikhwan to the community dinner.
In Indonesian, ikhwan is often used for â€œbrothers,â€ especially in religious settings.

definition.en: A shortened reference to the Muslim Brotherhood (Arabic: al-Ikhwan al-Muslimun), a political and social Islamist organization founded in Egypt in 1928.

examples.en: The article discussed the Ikhwanâ€™s role in modern Egyptian politics.
Some writers use â€œIkhwanâ€ as a shorthand for the Muslim Brotherhood.

definition.en: (historical) The Ikhwan, a religious militia movement in the early 20th century in the Arabian Peninsula associated with the rise of Saudi Arabia.

examples.en: Historians debate how the Ikhwan influenced early Saudi state formation.

summary.en: â€œikonâ€ is a less common spelling of â€œiconâ€: a famous symbol/person or a computer screen picture representing something.

definition.en: a less common spelling of â€œicon,â€ meaning a person, thing, or symbol that is widely recognized and strongly represents an idea, style, or culture

examples.en: Sheâ€™s a fashion ikon in her country.
The dove is an ikon of peace.

definition.en: in computing, a small picture/symbol on a screen that represents a program, file, or function (also usually spelled â€œiconâ€)

examples.en: Click the printer ikon to print the document.
I canâ€™t find the app ikon on my home screen.

summary.en: Ikona is a loanword meaning a religious icon (especially Orthodox), and sometimes a revered cultural symbol.

definition.en: (loanword, mainly Slavic use) A religious iconâ€”especially a painted image of Christ, the Virgin Mary, or saints used in Eastern Orthodox and Eastern Catholic worship.

examples.en: The family placed an ikona in the corner of the room for prayer.
In the museum, the ikona was displayed with other Orthodox devotional art.

definition.en: By extension, a person or thing treated as a cultural symbol or greatly admired figure (similar to â€œiconâ€).

examples.en: In local newspapers, she was called an ikona of the cityâ€™s theater scene.

summary.en: An icon is (1) a small symbol/picture (often on a screen), (2) a famous, widely admired person or thing, or (3) a religious image.

definition.en: a symbol or small picture that represents something (especially on a screen)

examples.en: Click the settings icon to change your password.
The app icon disappeared from my home screen.

definition.en: a very famous person or thing that is widely admired and represents a particular idea, style, or time

examples.en: She became a fashion icon in the 1990s.
The building is an icon of modern architecture.

definition.en: a religious image or painting, especially in Eastern Orthodox Christianity

examples.en: The church displayed icons of saints on the wall.

summary.en: â€œIkosâ€ is most commonly a proper name (Ikos Resorts). It can also refer to a Greek-derived word ending meaning â€œrelating to,â€ similar to English -ic/-ical.

definition.en: a brand name for a chain of luxury seaside resorts (Ikos Resorts), mainly in Greece and Spain.

examples.en: They booked a week at an Ikos resort in Greece.
Ikos is known for its all-inclusive luxury packages.

definition.en: (in word formation) a Greek-derived ending meaning â€œrelating to,â€ often appearing as -ic / -ical in English (e.g., poetic, historical).

examples.en: In English, the idea behind Greek -ikos often shows up as -ic, like 'basic' or 'classic.'
Many adjectives in academic writing come from Greek or Latin endings like this.

summary.en: Ikra is a Russian word commonly used in food contexts to mean fish roe (often salmon roe).

definition.en: (in Russian/Eastern European cooking) fish roe, especially salmon roe, often served as a delicacy.

examples.en: We ordered blini topped with ikra and sour cream.
The salad was finished with a spoonful of ikra for a salty, ocean taste.

definition.en: (literal meaning in Russian; less common in English) the calf of the leg (the back part of the lower leg).

examples.en: In Russian, â€œikraâ€ can also mean the calf of your leg.
